subject: Parenting
title: Spartan Child-Rearing
description: A fast breakdown of Spartan Child-Rearing for builders.

hook.text: At age seven, Spartan boys were taken from their families and sent to military barracks.

buildup.text: Sparta's agoge system was history's most extreme state-run child-rearing program.

discovery.text: Children were deliberately underfed, underclothed, and beaten to build toughness.

twist.text: This produced fierce warriors but a society so brittle it collapsed within two generations of its peak.

climax.text: Sparta's experiment proved that hardness without warmth creates strength without sustainability.

punchline.text: Toughness without connection builds soldiers, not civilizations.

quiz.question: At what age were Spartan boys taken from their families?
